result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Santino Ward

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Santino Ward in court, in custody, with Attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case is dismissed and read-in for Defendant's plea to Case #14CM420

Defendant Santino Ward in court, in custody, with Attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins. Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for bail motion hearing.  Attorney Perkins makes statements regarding request for bail modification/reduction.  State objects to any bail reduction.  Court denies request.   Bail remains as fixed.  Previously court date set remains on.
(Fax) ... for modifcation of bail. Filed by Atty Perkins.

Defendant Santino Ward in court, in custody, with Attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Perkins states she was just assigned this case and also requests a signature bond. Court requsts bail motion to be filed.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Defendant is not to have any violent contact with any school associate or student.   Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/ listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Santino Ward in court in custody   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.with attorney Reisha Mitchell for Atty. Joseph Smith.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
